doc.title: North America Alternative & Renewable Energy
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/North America Alternative Renewable Energy Week with Vik Retro Is Back in Fashion Week with Vik Retro Is Back in Fashion_2025-08-29

passages.text: Week with Vik: Retro Is Back in Fashion

Most discussions this week were focused on CSIQ as investors believe the court ruling (our notes here and here) and FEOC pose existential risk to the company. We believe the impact on industry from retroactive tariffs should be contained and FSLR is a clear beneficiary. Separately, majority of investors we spoke with agreed with our GNRC downgrade, but bulls see more catalysts and upside into 3Q. Finally, a lot of news on nuclear. Fusion deserves more attention given the amount of capital raise, number of new customer contracts, and technological progress.

GNRC Feedback - We downgraded GNRC to Neutral (note). Bulls argue: 1) RFPs in 3Q could push 2026 datacenter revenues comfortably above \(\) 200\mathrm{m}\(m; 2) channel checks indicate that 25% QoQ increase in 3Q residential revenues is achievable and in line with historical cadence; 3) announcements of datacenter capacity expansion should come sooner than mid - 2026. Bears argue: 1) shorting GNRC is tough given datacenter halo; 2) RE+ may not have positive ET announcements; 3) ET opex winddown will take longer than expected; 4) DC opportunity is fully priced; and 5) some risk in 2H due to tariffs and muted hurricane activity.

Reactor Roundup - We saw flurry of nuclear developments this week. Fuel: Citi commodities team expects uranium prices to reach \(\) 100/\mathrm{lb}\(in 2026 (note). Meaningful new enrichment capacity is only expected post - 2030 despite SWU price strength. Notably, Cameco (not covered) lowered (8/28) its 2025 production outlook by \~19% to \~14.5 million lbs of U308 for its McArthur River mine operation due to development delays. Separately, Centrus signed (8/25) an MOU with Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power (KHNP) and POSCO International to explore potential investment to support capacity expansion, along with an expanded LEU supply agreement. Lastly, the DOE announced (8/26) a second round of HALEU allocations with conditional commitments made to Antares Nuclear, Standard Nuclear, and Abilene Christian University/Natura Resources, based on the program's prioritization criteria. Some deliveries could occur this year. Initial allocations were made to five companies including TerraPower and Kairos Power in April. DOE still plans to make additional awards after this round. Agreements: X- energy, AMZN (covered by Ronald JoSe), KHNP, and Doosan announced (8/25) a partnership to accelerate the deployment of Xe- 100 SMRs and TRISO- X fuel. The agreement includes collaboration on design, supply chain, and construction. We note that X- energy has an existing relationship with Korean partners including DL E&C. Separately, Uthasigned (8/25) an MOU with TerraPower and land development firm Flagship Companies to evaluate a Natrium reactor and storage facility in the state. Preliminary site recommendations are expected by YE25. Fusion: Commonwealth FusionSystems, a private nuclear fusion developer that spun out of MIT in 2018, raised \(\) 8/28\(\) \ \(863\mathrm{mm}\) in a Series B2 round with participation from NVIDIA's venture capital arm. The company's \~\) 3B in total capital raised is expected to support efforts to commercialize the technology. Fusion has recently gained more attention (note). Continued below...

Reactor Roundup Continued: Reactors: NRC extended (8/26) design certification for Westinghouse's AP1000 reactor to 2046. For context, in June the NRC said it would extend the duration of design certifications to 40y from 15y previously. Separately, CEG (covered by Ryan Levine) said (8/27) that it is evaluating potential development of an advanced reactor or SMR at its Clinton facility in IL. Reporting: The EIA delayed (8/28) the publication of its annual uranium marketing report to September from June 2025. The report contains comprehensive data on uranium pricing and supply.

AD/CVD Investigation Progression — The US International Trade Commission made (8/29) affirmative determinations in the preliminary phase of its AD/CVD investigation of PV imports from Laos, Indonesia, and India. As a reminder, USITC and DOC run parallel investigative processes with dual affirmative determinations required at both the preliminary and final determination stages for the case to proceed for each country. The USITC is focused on whether the imports materially injure domestic industry. Separately, the DOC is expected to issue its preliminary CVD determinations in December 2025 and preliminary AD determinations in February 2026, barring any deadline extensions. We are primarily focused on the preliminary AD rates. The alleged dumping margins are \(\sim 89.7\%\) for Indonesia, \(\sim 245.8\% \sim 249.1\%\) for Laos, and \(\sim 214.0\%\) for India. See note for more detail.

Residential Electricity Price Recap — Residential electricity prices are projected to average \(\) 17\(/kWh in 2025, up 4\% Y/Y, and rise by\) \sim 6\% \(to\) \sim \$18k/kWh in 2026, per the EIA. Average natural gas costs are forecast to increase by\) \sim 17\% \(in 2026. Other factors include an aging distribution grid and robust demand from data centers, Al, and electrification. See Figure 1.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Boviet Solar (private) completed (8/27) exterior construction of its 3GW PV cell facility in NC, marking Phase II of its US expansion strategy. The plant is expected to begin mass production in 2H26 and will produce N-Type cells to complement Boviet's adjacent 2GW module factory that began operating in 1Q25. Cell production capacity is up from the 2GW initially planned.

ENPH began (8/27) shipping its IQ Battery 10C with US domestic content, targeting the third- party ownership (TPO) market. The battery meets the current \(45\%\) domestic content threshold for 2025 and will qualify under higher levels of \(50\%\) in 2026 and \(55\%\) in 2027 for tax eligibility. The product has been added to approved vendor lists, allowing developers to safe harbor.

ENPH also launched (8/27) new software allowing homeowners with IQ7 microinverters to expand capacity using IQ8 microinverters. The rollout extends to Australia, India, South Africa, and the Philippines after launching earlier in North America and Europe.

Ferrovial SE (covered by Ami Galla) announced (8/26) plans to develop a 250MW solar PV facility in TX, representing a \(\) 355\mathrm{mm}\(investment. Construction is expected to begin in the coming months.

ITM Power (covered by Vivek Midha), a PEM electrolyzer manufacturer, entered (8/26) a partnership with ABO Energy to advance green hydrogen projects in Europe, focusing on Spain and Finland. The collaboration will deliver hydrogen and infrastructure "as- a- service" through decentralized production units with ABO providing sites and development while ITM supplies PEM technology. The JV targets industrial offtake deals ahead of ITM's planned rollout of five UK hydrogen refueling stations in 2026.

PosiGen (private), a residential solar installer, ceased most of its operations (8/26) effectively immediately, as reported by PV magazine. The installer primarily served the Northeast market including NJ, CT, and MA. We note the company had secured an additional \(\) 200\mathrm{mm}\(in funding in January 2025, however, the company missed a debt interest payment in August.

Holtec International (private) announced (8/25) that its Palisades nuclear plant in MI has transitioned back to operations status, marking the first US facility to restart after decommissioning. The NRC approval allows the plant to receive fuel and restart once technical conditions are satisfied, following Holtec's 7/24 licensing package approval. Recall, Palisades plant was shut down in May 2022.

LEU signed (8/25) an MOU with Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power (KHNP) and POSCO International to explore investment in its OH enrichment plant. The deal builds on a February 2025 supply contract, with parties agreeing to increase enriched uranium volumes. Interestingly, US Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick attended the signing of the agreement.

Westinghouse (private) announced (8/26) that the NRC extended its AP1000 reactor design certification through 2046, lengthening validity from 14 to 40 years. The extension provides a long- term licensing basis to deploy AP10000 units in the
US and abroad, supporting US goals for 10 large- scale reactors under construction by 2030.
Figure 1. Chart of the Week: Average US Residential Electricity Rate (€/kWh)

Citi Research Equity Ratings Distribution

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of \(15\%\) or more or \(25\%\) or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "-" and "-" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re-establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short-term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds \(15\%\) against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.

Non- US research analysts who have prepared this report (i.e., all research analysts listed below other than those identified as employed by Citigroup Global Markets Inc.) are not registered/qualified as research analysts with FINRA. The proportion of all Citi Research research recommendations that were the equivalent to "Buy","Hold","Sell" at the end of each quarter over the prior 12 months (with the \(\%\) of these that had received investment firm services from Citi in the prior 12 months shown in brackets) is as follows: Q2 2025 Buy \(33\%\) (63%), Hold \(44\%\) (51%), Sell \(23\%\) (49%), RV 0.4% (86%); Q1 2025 Buy \(33\%\) (63%), Hold \(44\%\) (51%), Sell \(23\%\) (49%), RV 0.5% (87%); Q4 2024 Buy \(32\%\) (64%), Hold \(44\%\) (52%), Sell \(23\%\) (44%), RV 0.4% (92%); Q3 2024 Buy \(33\%\) (61%), Hold \(44\%\) (52%), Sell \(23\%\) (49%), RV 0.4% (80%). For the purposes of disclosing recommendations other than for equity (whose definitions can be found in the corresponding disclosure sections), "Buy" means a positive directional trade idea; "Sell" means a negative directional trade idea; and "Relative Value" means any trade idea which does not have a clear direction to the investment strategy.
